AS ANNOUNCED BY THE US SECRETARY OF TRANSPORTATION ON DECEMBER 19 2011 THE VERMONT AGENCY OF TRANSPORTATION (VTRANS) RECEIVED AN FY2011 AWARD ALLOCATION OF $352900 UNDER FTAS DISCRETIONARY SECTION 5309(B) VETERANS TRANSPORTATION AND COMMUNITY LIVING INITIATIVE. AN INITIATIVE THAT WILL IMPROVE TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS AND MOBILITY FOR AMERICAS VETERANS SERVICE MEMBERS AND THEIR FAMILIES. (SEE ATTACHED) THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SOFTWARE AND HARDWARE AS WELL AS WEB PAGES FOR VETERANS TRANSPORTATION AND WILL BRING THE DISABLED AMERICAN VETERANS (DAV)/U.S. VETERANS ADMINISTRATION (VA) TRANSPORTATION SERVICE INTO COORDINATION WITH EXISTING TRANSIT PROVIDERS AND SUPPORT THE UPGRADE OF THEIR DISPATCH SYSTEM. VERMONT IS SERVED BY 10 TRANSPORTATION AGENCIES AND ONE CONTRACTOR WHICH PROVIDE SERVICE TO THE ENTIRE STATE (SEE ATTACHED). THE DISABLED AMERICAN VETERANS PROGRAM RUNS A STATEWIDE SYSTEM OF VANS AND VOLUNTEER DRIVERS TO TRANSPORT VETERANS TO THE VETERANS ADMINISTRATION HOSPITAL IN WHITE RIVER JUNCTION. IN ADDITION THE VA RUNS ACCESSIBLE VANS BUT THEY ARE ONLY ABLE TO TRANSPORT THOSE VETERANS WITH A 10-30% DISABILITY FOR A SPECIFIC SERVICE RELATED INJURY AND FOR ANY MEDICAL REASON OVER 30% DISABILITY.THESE REQUIREMENTS LEAVE A SUBSTANTIAL NUMBER OF TRANSPORTATION NEEDS UNMET AND A GREATER NEED TO ENHANCE THE AWARENESS OF THE NON-DAV SERVICE RESOURCES AVAILABLE TO CURRENT AND EX MILITARY AND THEIR FAMILIES. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A WAY FOR A VETERAN WHO IS CALLING THE VA FOR SERVICE AND IS FOUND TO BE INELIGIBLE TO BE DIRECTED TO A TRIP THAT IS AVAILABLE TO THEM AT THE TIME THEY NEED. THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A NEW PARATRANSIT SCHEDULING AND DISPATCHING SYSTEM FOR THE DAV/VA THAT IS CONSISTENT WITH THE OTHER TRANSIT PROVIDERS WILL IMMEDIATELY IMPROVE SERVICE DELIVERY BOTH FOR OPERATIONAL DELIVERY PURCHASE OF SERVICES REFERRALS AND PROVISION OF INFORMATION. THIS WILL ALSO SET THE STAGE FOR FUTURE SYSTEM ENHANCEMENTS FOR EMERGING TECHNOLOGIES. IN PREPARATION FOR THIS PROJECT VERMONT WILL CONDUCT A PLANNING STUDY TO DETERMINE MORE SPECIFICALLY THE GAP IN TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TARGET THE IDEAL OUTREACH METHODOLOGY AND DETERMINE THE COMPLETE LIST OF SERVICE PROVIDERS AND THEIR PARTNERS.LOCAL MATCH WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH IN-KIND CALCULATION OF THE DISABLED AMERICAN VETERANS VOLUNTEER DRIVERS HOURS IN VERMONT.

DALLAS AREA RAPID TRANSIT HAS ASSEMBLED THE SUPPORT OF OVER THIRTY VETERAN TRANSPORTATION AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS FOR THIS SUBMISSION. TOGETHER THEY SERVE OVER 430000 VETERANS IN NORTH TEXAS. THE INTEREST IN THE PROJECT EXTENDS EAST TO TYLER TEXAS AND NORTH ALMOST THE OKLAHOMA. THIS SPEAKS TO THE TREMENDOUS NEED FOR INFORMATION ON TRANSPORTATION RESOURCES FOR VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES IN NORTH TEXAS. DART AND ITS PARTNERS PROPOSE TO DEVELOP AN OPEN-SOURCE SOFTWARE SYSTEM CALLED NORTHTEXASRIDES. THIS SYSTEM WILL LAY THE GROUNDWORK FOR AN EVENTUAL ONE-CALL/ONE-CLICK CENTER IN NORTH TEXAS. EARLY STAGES OF IMPLEMENTATION WILL BE A ONE-CLICK RESOURCE FOR PUBLIC USE THAT ALSO SUPPORTS EXISTING INFORMATION AND REFERRAL SERVICES SUCH AS 211 AND 511. IT WILL PROVIDE A COMMON DATABASE OF TRANSPORTATION INFORMATION ACCESSIBLE VIA WEB MOBILE AND SOCIAL APPLICATIONS AS WELL AS KIOSKS LOCATED THROUGHOUT THE REGION. THE GOAL IS TO BUILD A RESOURCE THAT HAS CURRENT ACCURATE AND MOST IMPORTANTLY ACTIONABLE INFORMATION ON TRANSPORTATION OPTIONS.WHILE THE FOCUS OF THE PROJECT IS VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES THE SCOPE IS UNIVERSAL. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE INFORMATION ON THE FULL FAMILY OF TRANSPORTATION SERVICES AVAILABLE IN THE REGION. THE NORTHTEXASRIDES SYSTEM WILL SERVE EMPOWER VETERANS MILITARY FAMILIES AND OTHERS TO ARRANGE TRANSPORTATION FOR DAILY NEEDS. THE PROJECT WILL ENHANCE EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN THE REGIONS TRANSPORTATION PROVIDERS COMMUNITY AND HUMAN SERVICES AGENCIES AND THE VETERAN AND MILITARY COMMUNITIES. IT WILL FORGE NEW PARTNERSHIPS AND INCREASE THE INVOLVEMENT OF VETERANS AND MILITARY COMMUNITIES IN THE LOCAL COORDINATED HUMAN SERVICES TRANSPORTATION PLANNING PROCESS. MATCH IS COVERED BY TOLL CREDITS AND A COPY OF THE CONTRACT WITH TXDOT IS ATTACHED.

THE PROJECT IS ALSO INTENDED TO SERVE SEVERAL MAJOR EMPLOYMENT AREAS AND KEY ACTIVITY CENTERS INCLUDING DOWNTOWN PITTSBURGH AND OAKLAND THAT ARE RESPECTIVELY THE FIRST AND SECOND GREATEST TRAFFIC GENERATORS AND THE TWO LARGEST COMMERCIAL EMPLOYMENT GENERATORS IN THE PITTSBURGH REGION. SCHUYLKILL VALLEY METRO PROJECT - PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT AMENDMENT IS TO REQUEST THE ADDITIONAL FUNDING THAT WAS APPROVED IN FY 2001 IN THE FEDERAL SHARE AMOUNT OF $9906431. THESE FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PARTIALLY FUND THE PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING PHASE OF THE SCHUYLKILL VALLEY METRO PROJECT. THIS GRANT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE PRELIMINARY DESIGN OF TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENTS IN THE SCHUYLKILL VALLEY METRO CORRIDOR FROM CENTER CITY PHILADELPHIA TO NORRISTOWN AND UPPER MERION TOWNSHIP MONTGOMERY COUNTY THEN WESTWARD THROUGH PHOENIXVILLE CHESTER COUNTY POTTSTOWN MONTGOMERY COUNTY TO THE READING AND WYOMISSING AREA OF BERKS COUNTY. IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE BERKS AREA READING TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY (BARTA) A MAJOR INVESTMENT STUDY/DRAFT ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT STATEMENT (MIS/DEIS) EFFORT WAS UNDERTAKEN THAT DEVELOPED AND COMPREHENSIVELY EXAMINED ALTERNATIVES TO IMPROVE TRANSPORTATION IN THE CORRIDOR. AS A RESULT OF THE STUDY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF SEPTA AND BARTA HAVE SELECTED METRORAIL AS THE LOCALLY PREFERRED ALTERNATIVE FOR THE SCHUYLKILL VALLEY METRO PROJECT. THE PROJECT WAS ALSO AMENDED INTO THE LONG RANGE TRANSPORTATION PLANS BY THE DELAWARE VALLEY REGIONAL PLANNING COMMISSION AND THE READING AREA TRANSPORTATION STUDY. THE MIS/DEIS PHASE OF THE PROJECT CONCLUDED WITH A 45 DAY PUBLIC REVIEW AND COMMENT PERIOD WHICH INCLUDED THREE PUBLIC HEARINGS HELD ON MARCH 5 6 AND 7 2002. ON JANUARY 25 2002 THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION GAVE SEPTA AND BARTA ITS APPROVAL FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF THE PROJECT TO PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING. THE PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING PHASE WILL BE CLOSELY COORDINATED WITH THE FOUR COUNTIES THE MUNICIPALITIES THE MPOS COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES AND OTHER INTERESTED STAKEHOLDERS. THE PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING PHASE WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: SCOPING AND DEFINITION PHASE ALTERNATIVE ANALYSES PHOTOGRAMMETRIC SURVEY AND BASE MAPPING CONCEPTUAL DESIGN OF PREFERRED ALTERNATIVE PROGRAM SCHEDULE AND PHASING PLAN ALTERNATIVE PROJECT DELIVERY SYSTEM ANALYSES AND RECOMMENDATIONS AND FINANCIAL PLAN. ADDITIONAL TASKS WILL BE INCLUDED TO SUPPORT THE CONCEPTUAL DESIGN AND FINANCIAL PLAN DEVELOPMENT. THESE TASKS INCLUDE: DEVELOPMENT OF AN OPERATING AND MAINTENANCE PLAN RIDERSHIP FORECASTING ESTIMATING GOVERNMENT AND THIRD PARTY AGREEMENTS SUPPLEMENTAL AA/DEIS FOR PREFERRED PHASING AND ROW PLAN PUBLIC INVOLVEMENT PROGRAM AND NORFOLK SOUTHERN FREIGHT NEGOTIATIONS SUPPORT.THE CURRENT ESTIMATED COST OF THE LOCALLY PREFERRED ALTERNATIVE IS $1.8 BILLION IN 2001 DOLLARS. ENTERPRISE REFERS TO THE MANAGEMENT OF THE ASSETS ACROSS DEPARTMENTS LOCATIONS FACILITIES AND IN SOME CASES BUSINESS UNITS. BY MANAGING ASSETS IN THIS WAY ORGANIZATIONS CAN IMPROVE UTILIZATION AND PERFORMANCE REDUCE CAPITAL COSTS REDUCE ASSET-RELATED OPERATING COSTS EXTEND ASSET LIFE AND SUBSEQUENTLY IMPROVE ROA (RETURN ON ASSETS).AS ORGANIZATIONS MOVE FROM HISTORICAL AND REACTIVE (RUN-TO-FAILURE) MODELS AND BEGIN TO EMBRACE WHOLE LIFE PLANNING LIFE-CYCLE COSTING PLANNED AND PROACTIVE MAINTENANCE AND OTHER INDUSTRY BEST PRACTICES ASSET MANAGEMENT IS A FUNDAMENTAL COMPONENT. COMPETITIVE PRESSURES FORCE ORGANIZATIONS TO MINIMIZE THE TOTAL COST OF ASSET OWNERSHIP AND STREAMLINE ASSET MANAGEMENT OPERATIONS (THESE TYPICALLY INVOLVE MYRIAD ACTIVITIES RANGING FROM INVENTORY PARTS AND LABOR MANAGEMENT TO CONTRACTS AND VENDOR MANAGEMENT FOR NEW WORKS). AS DOWNTIMES BECOME INCREASINGLY EXPENSIVE BOTH IN TERMS OF LOST PRODUCTION CAPACITY AND UNFAVORABLE PUBLICITY ORGANIZATIONS ARE COMPELLED TO MAXIMIZE THEIR ASSET PRODUCTIVE LIFE CYCLES VIA OPTIMAL MAINTENANCE PROGRAMS.IN THE EVENT OF ASSET FAILURE QUICK RESPONSE TIME IS CRITICAL. IN RECENT YEARS STRINGENT INDUSTRY-SPECIFIC ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH AND OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY REGULATIONS ARE BEING ENFORCED BY GOVERNMENT OVERSIGHT AGENCIES WITH INDUSTRIAL OWNERS AND OPERATORS RESPONSIBLE FOR COMPLIANCE. ASSET REGISTERS RISK REGISTERS WORK PLANNING AND SCHEDULING LIFE-CYCLE COSTING AND SYSTEMATIC METHODS FOR PROBLEM IDENTIFICATION ROOT-CAUSE ANALYSIS AND CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT ARE INCREASINGLY SEEN AS PREREQUISITES FOR A ROBUST ASSET MANAGEMENT SYSTEM.BY PROVIDING A PLATFORM FOR CONNECTING PEOPLE PROCESSES ASSETS INDUSTRY-BASED KNOWLEDGE AND DECISION SUPPORT CAPABILITIES BASED ON QUALITY INFORMATION EAM PROVIDES A HOLISTIC VIEW OF AN ORGANIZATIONS ASSET BASE ENABLING MANAGERS TO CONTROL AND OPTIMIZE THEIR OPERATIONS FOR QUALITY AND EFFICIENCY. EAM SYSTEMS ARE OFTEN NOT INTEGRATED WITH THE REST OF THE COMPANYS ENTERPRISE SYSTEMS (INCLUDING PURCHASING HR INVENTORY ETC.) WHICH INCREASES MANAGEMENT OVERHEAD AND PREVENTS THE ORGANIZATION FROM REALIZING THE SYSTEMS FULL POTENTIAL. THE PROCUREMENT OF THE ENGINEERING AND MAINTENANCE DIVISIONS EAM PLANS TO ADDRESS THESE ISSUES INCLUDING INTEGRATION WITH OTHER MBTA SYSTEMS SUCH AS THE ITD ORACLE BACKEND DATABASE PEOPLESOFT FINANCIAL AND MATERIALS INFORMATION SYSTEM THE CAPITAL ASSETS DATABASE HUMAN CAPITAL MANAGEMENT SYSTEM AND PARTICULARLY THE MBTA STATE OF GOOD REPAIR DATABASE AND THE TRANSIT ASSET MANAGEMENT PROJECT WHERE DATA FROM THE EAM WILL BE USED TO UPDATE THE DATABASES WITH ACTUAL COST AND CONDITION DATA. DATA FROM THE EAM SYSTEM WILL ASSIST IN THE MANAGEMENT AND AUDITING OF THE ENGINEERING AND MAINTENANCE DIVISION BY FTA AND MBTA. DATA FROM THE SYSTEM WILL ALSO HELP TO SUPPORT OPERATIONAL FUNDING REQUESTS FOR BOTH DAY-TO-DAY MAINTENANCE AS WELL AS LARGE SCALE CAPITAL EXPENDITURE PROJECTS.FOR THE PURPOSE OF THIS GRANT THE SCOPE CONSISTS OF HARDWARE INSTALLATION DATA CONFIGURATION AND MIGRATION SYSTEM TESTING TRAINING OF PERSONNEL AND DEVELOPMENT OF STANDARD OPERATING PROCEDURES. THE CITY OF FRESNO WAS SELECTED TO RECEIVE THESE FUNDS THROUGH A COMPETITIVE SELECTION PROCESS. AWARDS WERE ANNOUNCED ON JULY 23 2012; PROJECT LIST ON FTAS WEBSITE HERE: HTTP://WWW.FTA.DOT.GOV/ABOUT/13248_14745.HTML.THIS GRANT IS TO FUND A PROJECT AWARDED TO THE CITY OF FRESNO FRESNO AREA EXPRESS (FAX). TOTAL FEDERAL FUNDS REQUESTED ARE $2445300 WHICH REPRESENTS 100% OF TOTAL PROJECT COSTS. TRANSPORTATION DEVELOPMENT CREDITS (TOLL CREDITS) ARE USED IN LIEU OF THE REQUIRED LOCAL MATCH OF 17 PERCENT (SEE SPECIAL MATCH REQUIREMENT AS EXPLAINED IN NOFA P. 6182: HTTP://WWW.GPO.GOV/FDSYS/PKG/FR-2012-02-07/PDF/2012-2752.PDF) THIS GRANT APPLICATION INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING LIVABILITY PROJECT: DOWNTOWN BRT STATION AREA IMPROVEMENTS. THE FTIP PROJECT NUMBER IS FRE130068. FRESNO AREA EXPRESS (FAX) IS IN THE PROJECT DEVELOPMENT PHASE OF THE BLACKSTONE/VENTURA BUS RAPID TRANSIT (BRT) SERVICE LARGELY BE FUNDED THROUGH THE FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION (FTA) VERY SMALL STARTS PROGRAM. THE MAJOR STATION IN THE DOWNTOWN CORRIDOR WILL BE A MEDIAN RUNNING STATION LOCATED ON VAN NESS AVENUE AT MARIPOSA. THE STATION WILL SERVE COURTHOUSE PARK FAXS MAJOR TRANSFER STATION SERVING NINE FAX FIXED ROUTES. THE STATION WILL ALSO SERVE THE MARIPOSA MALL A PEDESTRIAN MALL THAT LEADS DIRECTLY TO THE FULTON CORRIDOR AND IS TWO BLOCKS AWAY FROM THE PROPOSED CALIFORNIA HIGH SPEED RAIL STATION. BECAUSE THIS IS A MID-BLOCK STATION TRANSIT RIDERS AND OTHER PEDESTRIANS WILL WALK ACROSS THE WIDE FOUR-LANE AVENUE WITHOUT UTILIZING A CROSSWALK AT EITHER INTERSECTION. THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A SIGNALIZED MID-BLOCK CROSSWALK AND MEDIAN ISLAND TO IMPROVE PEDESTRIAN SAFETY AND CONNECTIVITY BETWEEN THESE MAJOR TRIP GENERATORS. IN ADDITION A NEW PEDESTRIAN BRIDGE WILL BE DESIGNED (AND CONSTRUCTED IF FUNDING ALLOWS) THAT WILL SPAN THE SHORT DISTANCE OVER THE TOP OF THE PEDESTRIAN UNDERPASS STAIRWELL LINKING THE MID-BLOCK CROSSWALK TO THE PARK EDGE AND FORMING A STRAIGHT PATH ACROSS THE INTERSECTION TO THE MARIPOSA MALL FROM COURTHOUSE PARK. THIS PROJECT WOULD ALSO CONSTRUCT THE SIGNATURE STATION AT THIS LOCATION TO SUPPORT ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND LIVABILITY GOALS FOR THE FULTON CORRIDOR AND TO PROMOTE THE BRT SERVICE AS AN INTERMODAL CONNECTION THE HIGH SPEED RAIL STATION. ADDITIONALLY A PEDESTRIAN UNDERPASS IN THE SAME LOCATION WILL BE UPGRADED WITH NEW LIGHTING FIXTURES TO IMPROVE PEDESTRIAN COMFORT AND SAFETY. FRESNO IS IN THE CENTER OF CALIFORNIA (NORTH/SOUTH AND EAST/WEST) IN A REGION KNOWN AS THE CENTRAL VALLEY. THE CITY OF FRESNO (POP. 505900) WITHIN THE COUNTY OF FRESNO (POP. 947900) IS THE FIFTH LARGEST CITY IN CALIFORNIA. TRANSIT SERVICE IS PROVIDED THROUGH THE CITYS TRANSPORTATION DEPARTMENT ALSO KNOWN AS FAX. FAX IS THE LARGEST PROVIDER OF TRANSIT SERVICES IN THE COUNTY WITH 12.5 MILLION ANNUAL BOARDINGS. A HIGHLY EFFICIENT OPERATION FOR ITS SIZE FAX SERVICE CONSISTS OF 16 FIXED ROUTES WITH THREE MAJOR HUBS: THE DOWNTOWN TRANSIT MALL THE MANCHESTER TRANSIT STATION AND A TRANSFER POINT AT RIVER PARK IN NORTH FRESNO. FAX ALSO PROVIDES THE CITYS DEMAND-RESPONSE PARATRANSIT SERVICE CALLED HANDY RIDE TO ELDERLY AND DISABLED PERSONS THAT ARE UNABLE TO RIDE THE FIXED ROUTE SYSTEM. FAXS MISSION IS TO PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE TRANSPORTATION SYSTEM THAT IMPROVES THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN THE COMMUNITY.DOL CONTACT: DARLENE CHRISTIANSEN DARLENE.CHRISTIANSEN@FRESNO.GOV.
